wg_unicef_survey_data.intro: Each girl or boy grows and learns in their own way. This tool can help you learn what activities your boy or girl can do.
Each teen grows and learns in their own way. This tool can help you learn what activities your teen can do.

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.qst: Does your teen have difficulty seeing or hearing sounds like peoples’ voices or music, even with glasses or hearing aids?
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.options: No Difficulty|Some Difficulty|A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot See and/or Hear
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.concerning_options: A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot See and/or Hear
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.concerning_feedback: It seems like you're worried about your teenager's eyesight or hearing, and they might need help from a professional.

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.qst: Does your girl or boy have difficulty seeing or hearing sounds like peoples’ voices or music, even with glasses or hearing aids?

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.concerning_options: A Lot of Difficulty|He or She Cannot See and/or Hear
wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.concerning_feedback: It seems like you're worried about your boy or girl's eyesight or hearing, and they might need help from a professional.

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.qst: Compared with girls and boys of the same age, does your teen have difficulty walking?

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.concerning_feedback: It seems like you're worried about your teen's ability to move around, and they might need assistance from a professional.

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.qst: Does your teen have difficulty being understood by others?

wg_unicef_survey_questions_data.qst: Does your teen have difficulty learning or remembering things, focusing on an activity that he or she enjoys doing, or accepting changes in his or her routine?

swyc_survey_data.end_message_not_concerning:
Your boy or girl is growing and learning well. It is okay if they can't do everything mentioned in the questions. Most girls and boys can't do all of those things!;

If you ever need help, just type {HELP}.
swyc_survey_data.questions.1: Names at least 5 body parts - like nose, hand, or tummy
swyc_survey_data.questions.2: Climbs up a ladder at a playground
swyc_survey_data.questions.4: Jumps off the ground with two feet
swyc_survey_data.questions.5: Puts 2 or more words together - like "more water" or "go outside"
swyc_survey_data.questions.6: Uses words to ask for help
swyc_survey_data.questions.8: Tries to get you to watch by saying "Look at me"
swyc_survey_data.questions.9: Says his or her first name when asked

swyc_survey_data.intro:
Every girl or boy grows and learns differently. This tool can help find areas where your boy or girl might need assistance. To make it work, you need to answer all 10 questions.; 

How much is your girl or boy doing each of these things?
swyc_survey_data.end_message_not_concerning:
Your boy or girl is growing and learning well. It is okay if they can't do everything mentioned in the questions. Most girls and boys can't do all of those things!;

If you ever need help, just type {HELP}.
swyc_survey_data.questions.2: Tries to get you to watch by saying "Look at me"
swyc_survey_data.questions.3: Says his or her first name when asked
swyc_survey_data.questions.5: Talks so other people can understand him or her most of the time
swyc_survey_data.questions.6: Washes and dries hands without help (an adult can help turn on the water)
swyc_survey_data.questions.7: Asks questions beginning with "why" or "how" - like "Why no cookie?"
swyc_survey_data.questions.8: Explains the reasons for things, like needing a sweater when it's cold
swyc_survey_data.questions.9: Compares things - using words like "bigger" or "shorter"
swyc_survey_data.questions.10: Answers questions like "What do you do when you are cold?" or "…when you are sleepy?"

swyc_survey_data.intro:
Every girl or boy grows and learns differently. This tool can help find areas where your boy or girl might need assistance. To make it work, you need to answer all 10 questions.; 

How much is your girl or boy doing each of these things?
swyc_survey_data.end_message_not_concerning:
Your boy or girl is growing and learning well. It is okay if they can't do everything mentioned in the questions. Most boys and girls can't do all of those things!;

If you ever need help, just type {HELP}.
swyc_survey_data.questions.1: Talks so other people can understand him or her most of the time
swyc_survey_data.questions.2: Washes and dries hands without help (an adult can help turn on the water)
swyc_survey_data.questions.3: Asks questions beginning with "why" or "how" - like "Why no cookie?"
swyc_survey_data.questions.4: Explains the reasons for things, like needing a sweater when it's cold
swyc_survey_data.questions.5: Compares things - using words like "bigger" or "shorter"
swyc_survey_data.questions.6: Answers questions like "What do you do when you are cold?" or "…when you are sleepy?
swyc_survey_data.questions.7: Tells you a story from a book or TV
swyc_survey_data.questions.8: Draws simple shapes - like a circle or a square
swyc_survey_data.questions.9: Says words like "feet" for more than one foot and "men" for more than one man

swyc_survey_common_data.intro:
Every child grows and learns differently. This tool can help find areas where your child might need assistance. To make it work, you need to answer all 10 questions.; 

How much is your child doing each of these things?
swyc_survey_common_data.end_message_not_concerning:
Your child is growing and learning well. It is okay if they can't do everything mentioned in the questions. Most children can't do all of those things!;

If you ever need help, just type HELP

dev_assess_question_date_data.question: When was Your Child born? Enter their date of birth in the following format: DD/MM/YYYY. For example, if your child was born on May 19, 2010, enter 19/05/2010.
